original: Bjerksten, Gustaf Sigfrid, kyrkoherde, Rystad, f. 29/3/95 i Vist, Ö^ster-götl. 1., av folksk :lär. Nils Erik Carh-son o. Sofia Göransson. G. 23 m. Elsa Dahlson. Barn: Ingemar f. 24, teol. stud., Birgitta 27, Ingrid 29. — Stud:-ex. i Linköp. 15, teol. kand. i Lund 20, prästv. f. Linköp. stift 21. V. pastor i Dalhem 21-22, kommin. i Mörlunda o. Tveta 23-28, kyrkoh. i Rystad o. Östra Harg sed. 28. Ordf. i Mörlunda pens :nd samt Rystads skolstyr., kyrkostämma, past:stämma, fam:bi-dragsnd o. föreläsn :fören., v. ordf. i Rystads o. Östra Hargs RK-krets, ordf. i Östra Hargs skolråd o. kyrkostämma.
translated: Bjerksten, Gustaf Sigfrid, a pastor, was born on March 29, 1895, in Vist, Östergötland. He was the son of a elementary school teacher, Nils Erik Carhson and Sofia Göransson. He married Elsa Dahlson in 1923 and they had three children: Ingemar born in 1924 who studied theology, Birgitta born in 1927, and Ingrid born in 1929. Gustaf completed his high school studies in Linköping in 1915 and obtained a degree in theology from Lund in 1920. He was ordained as a priest for the Linköping diocese in 1921. From 1921 to 1922, he served as a deputy pastor in Dalhem, and from 1923 to 1928, he was a curate in Mörlunda and Tveta. Starting from 1928, he served as a vicar at Rystad and Östra Harg. He was the chairman of the Mörlunda pension committee, Rystad School Board, church meeting, parish council, family welfare board, and lecture association. Gustaf also served as the vice chairman of the Rystad and Östra Hargs RK district and was the chairman of the Östra Harg school board and church meeting.
